news.title: An obscure mosquito-borne disease goes global
news.summary: Science 27 November 2015: Vol. 350 no. 6264 pp. 1012-1013 DOI: 10.1126/science.350.6264.1012 In Depth Infectious Diseases A little-known virus called Zika has caused outbreaks in Pacific Ocean islands the past few years and has arrived in South…

news.title: Fast-spreading virus may cause severe birth defects
news.summary: An emerging virus that is causing an unprecedented epidemic in Brazil and is quickly spreading through Latin America may be responsible for a spike in severe birth defects.

facebook.title: An obscure mosquito-borne disease goes global
facebook.summary:
Is Zika virus the next big flavivirus? Still relatively unknown, cases have been confirmed outside of Africa over the past few years in Oceania and South America. There is a write up in this weeks Science magazine.

http://www.sciencemag.org/content/350/62

facebook.summary: "Science (AAAS), 27 November 2015, Vol. 350, no. 6264, pp. 1012-1013. In Depth: Infectious Diseases: Zika - An obscure mosquito-borne disease goes global. Author: M Enserink. Summary: A little-known virus called Zika has caused outbreaks in Pacific Ocean i

facebook.title: Timeline Photos
facebook.summary:
An obscure mosquito-borne disease goes global

A little-known virus called Zika has caused outbreaks in Pacific Ocean islands the past few years and has arrived in South America this year. Scientists predict it will spread far and wide in the Western Hemis

facebook.title: A rare, mosquito-borne virus that may cause birth defects is poised to reach America
facebook.summary:
Ae. aegypti: principal vector
Ae. albopictus (Asian tiger mosquito): accessory vector

Areas where Ae. aegypti are established have a much higher risk than those where only Ae. albopictus are established. Health officials should obviously remain vigilant,
